metadata.title: CVE-2022-22763 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When a worker is shutdown, it was possible to cause script to run late inthe lifecycle, at a point after where it should not be possible. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 96, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR <91.6.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
